sn23.23-33:4.2: Seated to one side, Venerable Rādha said to the Buddha:
sn23.23-33:4.3: “Sir, may the Buddha please teach me Dharma in brief. When I’ve heard it, I’ll live alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and determined.”
sn23.23-33:5.1: “Rādha, you should give up any desire, any greed, any desire and greed for whatever is Māra.
sn23.23-33:5.5: You should give up any desire, any greed, any desire and greed for it.
sn23.23-33:5.13: You should give up any desire, any greed, any desire and greed for it.
sn23.23-33:5.14: You should give up any desire, any greed, any desire and greed for whatever is Māra.
sn23.23-33:6.1: “You should give up any desire, any greed, any desire and greed for whatever is of Māra-like nature …”
